oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Handwritten letter to “the Honorable County Commissioners,” from Mrs. A.C. Parrish, Nashville, Tennessee, 1886 January 21
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A handwritten letter to “the Honorable County Commissioners, from Mrs. A.C. Parrish, dated Jan. 21st, 1886. She states her ownership of “80 ft. of ground on the west side of Sth College St. and known as Parrish’s Stable.” The First Ward of Nashville in the year 1880 began “at the Suspension Bridge, running west along the south side of the Public Square to College Street, along the Square to Deaderick Street, west on Deaderick Street to Cherry Street, south on Cherry Street to Demonbreun Street, east on Demonbreun Street in a direct line to the Cumberland River, thence along said river to the beginning.” Forms part of the Davidson County Court, Loose Records-Additions-Wards. 1letter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Parrish family
